head.supplied: Melbourne bot. Garden, ¶ 1. April ¶ 1858. ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to inform you, that Constable Martin enjoyes the privilege of keeping a cow chiefly with a view to facilitate for him the support...

div.p: E58/3817, unit 745, VPRS 1189 inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
1. April
May? The file containing M's letter is dated 1 May 1858, which is consistent with the dates of other items in the file. M is evidently responding to O'Shanassy's file note on M to J. O'Shanassy, 27 April 1858 (in this edition as 58-04-27b). 1858.
I have the honor to inform you, that Constable Martin enjoyes the privilege of keeping a cow chiefly with a view to facilitate for him the support of his family.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: your most obedient and humble servant

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
